newsitem.title: UK: TENNIS SPOTLIGHT-PROFILE OF WILLIAMS'S CONQUEROR GRZYBOWSKA.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS SPOTLIGHT-PROFILE OF WILLIAMS'S CONQUEROR GRZYBOWSKA.

text.p: Brief profile of Magdalena Grzybowska, the woman who beat American prodigy Venus Williams 4-6 6-2 6-4 in the first round at Wimbledon on Saturday:
Grzybowska, who reached 67th in the world rankings briefly a year ago, is currently ranked 91st.
A tall, powerful player she says she prefers to play on clay but has a good game for grass with a wide range of shots and an ability to come into the net.
In her only previous appearance at Wimbledon, last year, the former Australian Open junior champion was beaten in straight sets in the first round by compatriot Aleksandra Olsza.
She reached the third round of this year's Australian Open, her best Grand Slam performance as a senior.

Nationality: Polish. Unseeded. Age: 18. Plays: Right-handed. Height: 1.84 metres. Weight: 66 kgs. World ranking: 91. Tournament wins: Two. Career prize money: $157,452. Previous Wimbledon record: First round, 1996.
Next opponent at Wimbledon: Barbara Schett (Austria)
